Sure, here are some additional tips to ensure the property management company you choose is attentive to your needs and preferences:

1. Clarify Expectations: Be clear with the property management company on what you expect from them. This can include things like communication frequency, how repairs should be handled, or how extensive the tenant screening process should be. 2. Regular Communication: Set up regular communication with the property management company to keep abreast of any issues or concerns. This can also provide an opportunity for you to provide feedback and for them to update you on the property’s status. 3. Review Reports: Review the reports provided by the property management company on a regular basis. This can give you insight into the performance of your property, the rental market, and help you make informed decisions. 4. Feedback: Provide ongoing feedback to the property management company. This will help them know what they are doing well and where they may need to improve to better meet your preferences and needs. By doing these things, you can help ensure that the property management company you choose is attentive to your specific needs and preferences.
